channel.title: Jinying Cheng on <
channel.description: Recent content in Jinying Cheng on <

item.description: Hi, / This is Jinying. / … / I communicate through “Practice”. / Here i record my way of thinking, of exploring and experienmenting the real world almost every day, and the process is still on going. / To me, “design” is more about a tool of trying to seek and spot the problem, and searching for an unexpected solution. Through all kinds of media - no matter through sketches, through physical product, or through animation, through performance or photography, they are all my methods of “expressing the solution to a certain outcome”.

Introduction This tutorial will show you how to create a simple theme in Hugo. I assume that you are familiar with HTML, the bash command line, and that you are comfortable using Markdown to format content. I’ll explain how Hugo uses templates and how you can organize your templates to create a theme. I won’t cover using CSS to style your theme. We’ll start with creating a new site with a very basic template.

Introduction This tutorial will show you how to create a simple theme in Hugo. I assume that you are familiar with HTML, the bash command line, and that you are comfortable using Markdown to format content. I’ll explain how Hugo uses templates and how you can organize your templates to create a theme. I won’t cover using CSS to style your theme. We’ll start with creating a new site with a very basic template.

item.title: Migrate to Hugo from Jekyll
item.description: Move static content to static Jekyll has a rule that any directory not starting with _ will be copied as-is to the _site output. Hugo keeps all static content under static. You should therefore move it all there. With Jekyll, something that looked like ▾ <root>/ ▾ images/ logo.png should become ▾ <root>/ ▾ static/ ▾ images/ logo.png Additionally, you’ll want any files that should reside at the root (such as CNAME) to be moved to static.

item.title: (Hu)go Template Primer
item.description: Hugo uses the excellent Go html/template library for its template engine. It is an extremely lightweight engine that provides a very small amount of logic. In our experience that it is just the right amount of logic to be able to create a good static website. If you have used other template systems from different languages or frameworks you will find a lot of similarities in Go templates. This document is a brief primer on using Go templates.

item.title: Getting Started with Hugo
item.description: Step 1. Install Hugo Go to Hugo releases and download the appropriate version for your OS and architecture. Save it somewhere specific as we will be using it in the next step. More complete instructions are available at Install Hugo Step 2. Build the Docs Hugo has its own example site which happens to also be the documentation site you are reading right now. Follow the following steps: Clone the Hugo repository Go into the repo Run hugo in server mode and build the docs Open your browser to http://localhost:1313 Corresponding pseudo commands:

/ Breezy is a pneumatic experiment designed to help people with scars to care for their neck health and ear health. Finished during 1 month of teaching assistant period in Tongji Fablab O, Shanghai, China. / “ Scar is your breathing beauty.” / Year: 2020 Watch the prototype video here: https://vimeo.com/579725521

/ A 4-week CAID course during the study in Umeå Institute of Design. During the CAID courses we attended lessons on digital surface modelling and visualization and rendering software. The 4-week course consists of lectures and practical training and is carried out under teacher guidance. / We were asked to select our own product to model, which i chose the Sony headset. The most difficult part was to model the joint surface.

/ This conceptual project was completed during DigitalFutures workshop – Soft Touch, instructed by professor Sofia Guridi and Emmi Pouta from Aalto University in Finland. The workshop aimed at combining electronic components with flexible textile materials to obtain some further product solutions or concepts. / North pole is shifting. According to researchers, due to the severe climate change, the pole has been moving steadily eastward by about 75 degrees, heading toward the Prime Meridian that runs through Greenwich, England.
/ Experienments through variable medias. / Year: 2021 - on going /year: 2022 /media: touchdesigner

/ Term project - Design Strategy / / Teammate: Indalecio Gaytan. / Year: 2022-2023. / Mentoring: FLIR, Thomas Degn, Alex Liebert.

/ Term project - “Future Traffic Controls and Interventions”, designed during introduction project in Umea Institute of Design, collaborated with Swedish Polis. / The project aim is to focus on improving the working environment of the police officers maintaining order and traffic safety, and the tools and equipment they depend on for doing this. / Individual project. / Year: 2022-2023. / Mentoring: Thomas Degn, Johan Gustafsson, Jens Asserlind, Linda Bogren.

/ Concept project designed for Grado (Room 514, Building 1, Wpark Binan rd. No.1181, Binjiang District, Hangzhou, Zhejiang), during intership in Circ Industrial Design in Shanghai, China. / Year: 2022. / Mentoring: Mugi Yamamoto & Eric Cross.
